result.execSummary:
The defendant Charles P Lambert was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Child Pornography, a class D felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.12(1m).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Dodge Correctional Institution as reception facility. 
Defendant is not eligible for the Substance Abuse Program.  
Defendant is not eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program.

superMiscConds.notes: If probation or extended supervision is allowed to expire or is revoked with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge and provide current financial information.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for any balances due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.  Attorney Fees To Be Determined.  Probation does NOT collect attorney fees.
Must have no unsupervised contact with children under the age of 18.

Must complete any and all evaluations, counseling, treatment and follow-up recommended by Probation Agent. Must undergo a psychosexual evaluation and comply with recommended follow-up treatment. Must register as a sex offender for life. Must submit DNA sample and pay the surcharge.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Charles P Lambert in court with attorney Matthew Krische.  John Michael O'Boyle appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
No changes to PSI.  Stipulate to 2 days jail credit.  Argument by State.  Argument by Attorney Krische.  Defendant relates.  Court relates and orders:

Total length of sentence 13 years 0 months
Initial Confinement 3 years 0 months - Credit for 2 days
Extended Supervision 10 years 0 months
Dodge Correctional Institution as reception facility
Is not eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program
Is not eligible for the Substance Abuse Program

Conditions:
Must complete any and all evaluations, counseling, treatment and follow-up recommended by Probation Agent
Must undergo a psychosexual evaluation and comply with recommended follow-up treatment
Must have no unsupervised contact with children under the age of 18
Must register as a sex offender for a lifetime
Must submit DNA sample and pay the surcharge
Court costs
2 $500.00 pornography surcharges

Order for DNA given to the defendant in court - Sample to be taken before being transported to prison.
Voting rights and firearm warning given.  WEDS given.  Defendant remanded into custody.

Defendant Charles P Lambert in court with attorney Matthew Krische.  Rachel Kibbe appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Attorney Krische recites agreement.  Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights presented and discussed.  Guilty plea entered to Count 1.  The Court finds plea is knowingly, intelligently and voluntarily given and finds the defendant guilty.  Counts 2, 3, 4 and 5 are Dismissed and Read In.  Court orders PSI.  Bond continued.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for April 5, 2016 at 02:00 pm.
